name: Granulomatous Lymphocytic Interstitial Lung Disease (GLILD)
chief_complaint: I've been having a persistent dry cough and feel short of breath, especially when walking.
prognosis: Variable; may progress to respiratory failure without treatment. Early immunosuppressive therapy can stabilize lung function.
description: GLILD is a rare pulmonary complication of common variable immunodeficiency (CVID) characterized by granuloma formation and lymphocytic infiltration of lung parenchyma. It represents a complex interplay between immune dysregulation and chronic inflammation.
